alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris; Red River; Titus (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 2:45AM CDT until March 26 at 1:01AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Shreveport LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Sulphur River Near Talco affecting Morris, Franklin, Red River and Titus Counties. For the Sulphur River...including Talco...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sulphur River Near Talco. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that may have cattle and equipment in the river bottoms should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 21.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet on 06/13/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued later this morning at 1030 AM CDT.
